txt.en: 'We must hurry, with Narchuil reforged it will not be long before all of Eriador is overrun.'
'Are you ready to continue, [placeholder]?'

'It is done... Mordirith's spirit is gone, thrown into the void... never to return... I fear, though, it has cost me what grace remained within me and my time here in this Middle-earth is ending....\n\n'Nay... do not weep! I would gladly pay this price again. I now can leave these shores knowing that I have helped, in a small way, push back... the darkness I served for so very long. Soon, I will see my mother... my father....'

Her life spent defeating Mordirith, the lifeless form of Narmeleth lies before you. Her face, once wracked with guilt and sorrow, is now at peace.\n\nYou should now return to Gath Forthnír to let them know all that has transpired.
'We must hasten if we are to take Mordirith unawares.'
'Let us end this, [placeholder].'
'I sought for power, for approval, for brave and heroic deeds...'
'That which I sought has turned to ash... it was all for naught, and I am only Narmeleth.'
'We need haste, for we still must deal with Mordirith.'
'We must hasten if we are to take Mordirith unawares.'
'Let us continue, [placeholder].'
'What foul devilry is this?'
'I know not what lies ahead. Ready yourself, [placeholder]!'
'I do not know what we will find behind this door.'
'Ready yourself, [placeholder].'
'Let us end this, [placeholder].'
'Ah, Amarthiel, I welcome thee to Gador Gúlaran.'
'Your arrival here is not unexpected, although your companions do surprise me.'
'Did you beguile them with winsome words of how you sought to redeem yourself?'
'How laughable!'
'I know what you truly seek. You wish to overthrow me again and regain Angmar!'
'We shall see about that, \qNarmeleth.\q We shall see....'
'Look!'
'Guard your thoughts! Mordirith may use them against us!'
'NEVER!'
'Father?'
'The flowers of Lindon! I can see them once more....'
'Father, no!'
'We have been waiting for you, traitor!'
'Enough of this, Mordirith. Face me, you coward!'
'The traitor must die.'
'Carefully now, let us cross over to the other side.'
'As you wish, Narmeleth!'
Talk to Narmeleth
'Oh, you have struggled hard... but it was all for naught.'
Follow Narmeleth
'Here you shall die, your hopeless quest for redemption a failure.'
Talk to Narmeleth
'Amarthiel, though, long will her deeds be remembered!'
Defeat Mordrambor
'All those enslaved by Angmar will curse her name... and the name of her father!'
'Narmeleth...'
Talk to Narmeleth
'\qLaerdan the Fool\q he shall be called!'
'How could you betray me?'
Defeat Mordirith
'Laerdan, whose pathetic love for his daughter blinded him and doomed all of Eriador!'
'When I was the only one who cared for you!'
Talk to Narmeleth when you have readied yourself
Defeat Mordirith
'The traitor... get her!'
Speak to Narmeleth
'Our final task is nearly at hand. Prepare yourself!'
You have failed to protect Narmeleth
You have failed to protect Narmeleth
You have failed to protect Narmeleth
'It is not possible... Narchuil was mine....'
'Come, Narmeleth...'
'There is much that I can still teach thee!'
Instance: One Hope Remains
'Silence, False King!'
'I seek your overthrow, true... but I seek the downfall of all of Angmar as well!'
'Narchuil is gone, destroyed! I am free of the Dark Lord's influence!'
'I am Amarthiel no longer! I am Narmeleth, as my father named me!'
'We must hurry.'
'I only have the strength to aid one of you, so make sure only one of your number approaches Mordrambor.'
'With Narchuil reforged it will not be long before all of Eriador is overrun.'
'Narchuil must be destroyed and Mordirith stopped.'
'Mordrambor, give up this madness.'
'Throw Narchuil into the flames! It will be your undoing!'
'Madness? Nay, Amarthiel, it is thou who hast fallen into madness.'
'Go now! One of you must fight Mordrambor in my name!'
'Madness is challenging Mordrambor, Champion of Angmar!'
'With this ring I wielded great power...'
'With Narchuil's power, I will lead an army against Imladris, and none shall stand in my path!'
'Armies fell before me, and enemies trembled at my very name.'
'All the deeds I did as Amarthiel, Champion of Angmar....'
'Daughter...'
'How could you betray me...?'
'Your own father...'
The last hope to defeat Mordirith, the False King of Angmar, is a final assault on him in his stronghold of Gador Gúlaran.
'Look at what you have done...'
'You are selfish and weak. You will never defeat Mordirith!'
'Look! The cavern's shaking has knocked one of the columns over.'
Protect Narmeleth
'I think we are nearing Mordrambor... I can sense Narchuil's nearness.'
'I fear that if we must fight Mordrambor, I cannot approach him too closely.'
'Otherwise, Mordrambor could use Narchuil's power to dominate my mind.'
'Instead, one of you must approach him and fight in my name.'
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith and Mordrambor.
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith and Mordrambor.
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith and Mordrambor.
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith and Mordrambor.
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith and Mordrambor.
Journey with Narmeleth to defeat Mordirith.
Speak to Narmeleth.\n\nWith the last of her strength, Narmeleth drove the broken blade into the chest of Mordirith. His crumpled form lies near the collapsed form of Narmeleth.
